description: Upper maisonette remodelled to create a spacious top floor open-plan living space. Bespoke kitchen, dining and lounge furniture. Full height doors and a Dougls Fir stair screen

factsheet.heading: 130 Drayton Park
paragraphs:
K    N    O    T    T    A    R    C    H    I    T    E    C    T    S 
OPEN HOUSE 2024 
130 DRAYTON PARK 
London N5 1LX 
This project involves the remodelling of a two storey upper maisonette near the Arsenal 
Stadium. 
The original flat featured a dark entrance stairway, from the communal entrance, leading to 
two bedrooms on the first floor, and a kitchen and living room on the second.  
Initially the owner just wanted to improve the kitchen, and possibly open up between the 
kitchen and living room. Extending into the loft space was also considered. 
Many possible layouts were explored before deciding on completely opening up the top 
floor, creating an open plan kitchen / dining / living space, with an open stairway leading to 
it. 
It was also decided to put in a glass landing to the open stairway, allowing daylight down to 
the entrance. 
A new, finely crafted Douglas Fir stair screen connects the various levels, acting as 
handrail, balustrade, and fire wall. 
Tall floor to ceiling doors were installed on the bedroom level, accentuating the loftiness of 
the spaces, and allowing more light through. 
The kitchen is Knott Architects designed, with dyed concrete worktops, and birch ply units. 
The Client was able to make it entirely bespoke, to their requirements, including a bridging 
shelf across the rear window, providing a place to perch and watch the world outside.
